claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A screenshot of the title and opening of an original article, including a line in the abstract stating, “trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines, and the recombinant strain is less susceptible to antigenic drift during manufacturing.” Evidence: trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines The image shows that recombinant influenza vaccines have three times the hemagglutinin content of standard-dose egg-based vaccines but does not provide any data or statements linking this to greater immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in its entirety Note: Evidence of antigen content is clear, but no information on immunogenicity is visible

detailed_analysis.image_description: A screenshot of the title and opening of an original article, including a line in the abstract stating, “trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines, and the recombinant strain is less susceptible to antigenic drift during manufacturing.”

detailed_analysis.reasoning: The image shows that recombinant influenza vaccines have three times the hemagglutinin content of standard-dose egg-based vaccines but does not provide any data or statements linking this to greater immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in its entirety
